modules.description: Handles message passing between components using unique identifiers. Processes incoming messages by waiting for a sender ID and associated data, and sends messages to specific IDs with structured payloads. Operates with a private string type for identity and asynchronous I/O through Lwt.

manages message routing via unique string-based identifiers, enabling asynchronous communication between components. It supports receiving messages by waiting for sender IDs and data, and sending structured payloads to specific targets. The module uses Lwt for non-blocking I/O and defines a private identity type to ensure safe message handling. Examples include broadcasting updates to registered clients or querying a specific component for status information.

Handles asynchronous monitoring of ZeroMQ sockets by receiving event notifications. Operates on ZeroMQ sockets and event data structures, allowing real-time tracking of socket state changes. Used to detect connection drops, message sends, or other socket-related events in concurrent network applications.

Provides zero-copy message passing between threads using Lwt for asynchronous I/O, and supports PUB/SUB, REQ/REP, and PUSH/PULL socket patterns. Operates on ZMQ.message and Lwt.t types for non-blocking communication. Enables real-time data streaming and distributed task coordination in networked applications.

routes messages using string-based identifiers, enabling asynchronous communication between components through Lwt-based non-blocking I/O. It defines an identity type for safe message handling and supports sending structured payloads to specific targets or broadcasting to registered clients. It also monitors ZeroMQ sockets for real-time event notifications, such as connection status changes or message delivery confirmations. This allows for responsive network applications that react to both message traffic and socket events.
